---
title: "Regression Machine Learning Analysis Results"
author: "Dunkley Lab"
date: "`r format(Sys.time(), '%d %B, %Y')`"
output: 
  pdf_document:
    fig_caption: true
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(fig.path=file.path(tempdir(), 'OUTPUT/REGRESSION/UNIVARIATE/'), echo = FALSE)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(fig.path=file.path(tempdir(), 'OUTPUT/REGRESSION/ML_SVM/'), echo = FALSE)
```


This is a report of all the images generated via the Univariate analysis. We can format this code using LaTex formatting. These first plots are for UNIVARIATE analysis.

```{r, echo=FALSE}
myimages<-normalizePath(list.files(file.path(tempdir(), 'OUTPUT/REGRESSION/UNIVARIATE/'), pattern = ".pdf", full.names = TRUE))
myimages <- gsub("\\\\", "/", myimages)
knitr::include_graphics(myimages)
```

The SVM plots follow.


```{r, echo=FALSE}
myimages<-normalizePath(list.files(file.path(tempdir(), 'OUTPUT/REGRESSION/ML_SVM/'), pattern = ".pdf", full.names = TRUE))
myimages<- myimages[c(1:2,4:14)]
myimages <- gsub("\\\\", "/", myimages)
knitr::include_graphics(myimages)
```
